title: Log Horizon - S1 720p BluRay Dual Audio HEVC 10bit x265 [KoTuWa]
description:
[AnimeRG] Log Horizon - S1 (720p) BluRay (Dual Audio) HEVC 10bit x265 [KoTuWa] 
============================================================================== 
 
01-25 Batch. OP,ED. 3.24 GiB. 
 

--  
http://i.imgur.com/iqbK3oO.jpg 
-- 

Container         : MKV 
Video             : HEVC x265 10 bit. 1280x720. ~slower CRF 20 
Audio             : English, Japanese. AAC (HE) cVBR QAAC 
Subtitles         : English (4 tracks) 
                    Signs + Full 3 SoftSubs (OP,ED kFx HardSub) 
 
 
Use a reputed media player that can play x265 10bits has proper ASS subtitle support. 
Detailed playback help included in 'How_to_Play_ ' file in the torrent. 
MPC-HC, MPC-BE, MPV... are recommended :]  
http://mpc-hc.org   
http://mpcbe.sourceforge.net 
VLC and players like latest GOM, KMP with LAV can play HEVC, but MPC-HC, MPC-BE, MPV... with madVR gives better quality :) 
Linux, Mac, Chrome : libde265 - VLC libde265 plugin or, GStreamer libde265 plugin or ...  
http://libde265.org/downloads-software 
In Mobile, Android, Tabs, use a media player like MX Player, VLC Player... that can play H.265. 
For more info, read the 'How_to_Play_ ' file inside the torrent. 
 
Correctly rendered Styles and Karaoke effects should look like screenshots linked below.

Note 
==== 
Source: [deanzel]'s 1080p package, which has, 
SallySubs video and FLAC JAP audio and ENG audio from Chrisazter/MoodKiller DVD. 
HardSubbed OP,ED by SallySubs and Sings n Songs SallySubs+deanzel track and Full SallySubs+deanzel sub track and Full Zurako+deanzel sub track. 
 
Video encoded into 720p x265 10bit using ~slower+ preset at crf 20, marginally sharpened as the BD looks little dull. OP,ED encoded with CRF 18 placebo+ preset, moderate detail enhancement. 
Both audio tracks encoded into HE-AAC ConstrainedVBR max quality given by Apple AAC Encoder (QAAC/CoreAudioToolbox). Audio in OP,ED are AAC LC TrueVBR max quality Q127. 
Subtitles are slightly modified. Fixed some issues with timing and signs I found randomly. Didn't had resource related time to go through each and every line though! :( 
For ppl who hate LTFinnegan (there are many) AND prefer simple fonts (not many), an extra track added with a different dialogue font :) 
 
Overall, the source video looks better than this. But in certain places, this looks same or better ;)
